result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Gregory Pierce

defendant.name: Pierce, Kenneth Gregory
defendant.address: 2719 North Dr Martin Luther King Drive #202, Milwaukee, WI 53212

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Motions to Admit Statements of JAL and JYR on the Basis of Forfeiture by Wrongdoing.
MOTION TO JOIN 22CF2638 AND 22CF4083 FOR JURY TRIAL.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Kenneth Gregory Pierce not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Kenneth Gregory Pierce.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Arguments heard as to defense's bail motion. Court denies defense's bail motion. Case remains calendared for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.
Speedy trial demand, filed. Speedy trial demand expires on 01/17/2023.
EXPIRES 1-12-2023

Defendant Kenneth Gregory Pierce not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Kenneth Gregory Pierce.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. State advises of additional charges to be filed and joinder motion. Defense advises has advises client of new charges. Defense also request bail hearing. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court further advises parties that after final pretrial date court will not accept any reduction of charges plea deal. Court orders case adjourned for bail hearing, final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Gregory Pierce not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Kenneth Gregory Pierce.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defense's bail motion argued. 
For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defense's bail motion. Defense enters speedy trial demand. Speedy trial expires 12-27-22. State request sidebar off record. Court grants. Sidebar held. 
Defense withdraws speedy trial demand due to information given in off record side bar. Defense will need to speak with client before entering speedy  Court grants withdraw at this time. Defense requests status date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (15 pages) commencing 09-15-2022, by Debra A. Wisniewski.

Defendant Kenneth Gregory Pierce appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Kenneth Gregory Pierce.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #14CF5646. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective O. Phillips. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense Counsel requests to be heard on bail. Case is adjourned to Branch 04.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Gregory Pierce not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Kenneth Gregory Pierce.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  status of this case.  (Kenneth G. Pierce, House of Correction - P6 / 60, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court by video, defendant Kenneth Gregory Pierce not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to court congestion and the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion for Bail Reduction.

Defendant Kenneth Gregory Pierce in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kenneth Gregory Pierce in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to Court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed

Court ordered no contact with J.T.C, J.A.L, and  J.Y.R
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kenneth Gregory Pierce in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke and Sudent Intern Simon Earle.  Defendant Kenneth Gregory Pierce in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
